comment.brief: New objects are always new, never matched to an existing one
comment.full: New objects are always new, never matched to an existing one

comment.brief: The `IdentityKey` is used to compare objects. This value is chosen implicitly if `IdentityKey` is used.
comment.full: The `IdentityKey` is used to compare objects. This value is chosen implicitly if `IdentityKey` is used.

comment.brief: Use the object itself as the matching key. Suitable for when the object is a plain string or number.
comment.full: Use the object itself as the matching key. Suitable for when the object is a plain string or number.

comment.brief: Reuses existing nodes if the new objects match the old ones.
comment.full:
Reuses existing nodes if the new objects match the old ones.

This field is typically set implicity. It defaults to `None`. Use `IdentityKey` instead if you want to match based on a id field.

If you need to match on the observable value itself, set this to `Object`, otherwise it works like `IdentityKey`
